Reviews.Title: “Great for folks traveling on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: mollybeatrice
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel based on the mixed reviews from trip advisor, but booked based on their unbeatable price. I was absolutely satisfied with our stay and would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly - as long as your priorities match those of the hotel. The hotel is clean, spacious for European standards, and very centrally located. Was our double bed two twin beds pushed together? Yeah. Was there WIFI or an internet connection? No. Was there a phone in the room? No. But, our room was clean with plenty of space and a big(ish) bathroom, the hotel had a very friendly staff, and included a lovely, authentic Italian breakfast downstairs. And for the price, I'd say it's a steal - it's less expensive than two bunk beds in a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Fully Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Suci L
Reviews.Content: we went to Rome from 4-9 January 2012 and stayed at this hotel. the room was small, but it's worth the price. "don't expect a steak when you order burger". the staffs are friendly and really helpful. you have a door which can be open which allow us to smoke and you also can hang your clothes outside if you want to wash your clothes. :) the elevator only fits maximum for 2 person. we chose to use the stairs instead. we should have had simple breakfast in the morning, but we did not take it because you can find many affordable restaurants nearby with very delicious taste. one thing a bit bothered us is the wall papper in some parts already been ripped. but it was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: drummerSwanseaU_k_
Reviews.Content: We spent four days here in Febuary and it was our second time in this hotel. It is fine for a cheap central hotel where you can walk in safety to most of Rome's sites. Rome can be expensive but there are a few more resonably priced restaurants and bars close by. We also found the staff and the cafe downstairs helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jayp49
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the Stazione Termini and close to many good trattorias frequented by locals. The room was clean and adequate but no frills. You have to walk up a flight of steps to get to the lobby. The elevator starts ar the lobby level but can be inoperative if too many pile into it. Basically at 75 euro per night it was a good value compared to the more pricey hotels in the city.The staff was friendly and helpful in arranging a taxi to the airport at a few euro more than the train.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy1284
Reviews.Content: First, the worst place you can ever stay in while visiting Rome is this area where the hotel located, Termini. Second, it is not a hotel, it's a wierd place. The rooms are extra small, not dirty to be honest, just in front of the hotel lies a strip club. Third, the transportation from the hotel is really bad, no near metro, the buses are very complicated to understand from this area. Avoid Termini area and avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: citizenK8
Reviews.Content: Decent location, near various embassies. 10 minute walk from station. Nice cheap restaurant just opposite. Fair sized room, quite clean, had a small fridge - all comfortable enough. Breakfast is nothing to get excited about. Not sure if it was just our room, or a general problem, but next door's plumbing was very noisy, and ours was smelly (i.e. occasional foul waft from loo/drain). Given this, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again. (Though maybe we were just unlucky with room - apart from noise/smell, hotel was OK for the price).

Reviews.Title: “"Virginia" hotel Samos”
Reviews.Author: ellina k
Reviews.Content: beautiful and quite place,with beautiful romantic view to Samos Town and the port of Samos.Clean rooms,nice service,friendly people

Reviews.Title: “TO AVOID ABSOLUTLY”
Reviews.Author: Etienne V
Reviews.Content: To sum up our 2 nights staying in this hotel: ICE-COLD WATER in the room, incompetent staff unable to find a solution, and worse than that, without any will to solve the issue. The manager even don't answer to the claim by email. In this place you're a "billing number and that's all, IF YOU'RE FACING ANY PROBLEM, DON'T IMAGINE TO BE CONSIDERED OR UNDERSTOOD. There are a lot of over great places near the Termini station at the same cost but without the problems!

Reviews.Title: “It worths what you have paid”
Reviews.Author: jonathanstf
Reviews.Content: We are young couple who have stayed there for 3 nights in July 2011. We need a neat place for sleeping and bathing. 50 EURO per night, clean and soft bed, air-conditioned, breakfast included (sweet bun with coffee, honestly, it tastes good), 8-10mins walk to central station. It is really good for young traveller with limited budget on accommodation. But, bathroom is really small, if you are 6'0 with 200lb, don't think about it. I am 5'8" in 70kg. I hardly turn 360 in the bath. Anyway, I only stay 10 mins in the bathroom everyday. It is not a big deal to us. In a nutshell, I do recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: juandi89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Virginia for 3 nights. The location is great as it is near Termini station and the airport shuttle stop. It is easy to find the hotel even if you had never been in Rome. Just outside the hotel you can find several cafes, good restaurants, laundry places, and 2 blocks away there's a little market that opens in the morning, where you can find interesting stuff. The staff was very friendly, they helped me with everything I needed and they spoke English and Spanish very well. The room was just next to the lobby, sometimes it could get noisy but at night I didn't hear anything. It was clean, a little bit on the small side (I think all rooms in Rome are a bit like that), the wallpaper were a little worn out but otherwise it was a good room. Breakfast was provided in the cafe next door, but don't expect too much, it just consisted of a croissant and a cup of coffee. Anyway, For the price and location, I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but very dull hotel”
Reviews.Author: ster312
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the only plus, as it is close to the train station which connects to anywhere in the city. But the hotel is very dull and old and the rooms are small. But for the price, this hotel is not bad especially for backpackers or young travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kts66
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights at the Virginia Hotel and were very pleased with our stay there. We paid €70 a night for an air-conditioned double room with a private bathroom, which is a bargain in Rome. The room was small, but very clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable; we even had a little balcony opening onto the courtyard. The first night we did notice some noise from the bar next door, so that meant we couldn't sleep with the window open, but if it had gotten too stuffy, we could have turned on the air-conditoning. The reception is open 24 hours a day, and the staff are very friendly and efficient. A continental breakfast, served at the bar next door, is included. The little outdoor eating area is a great spot for people-watching -- we really enjoyed observing the locals stopping by for their morning coffee. The location is good -- at most it's a 10 minute walk from the Termini station, and about a half-an-hour to the Trevi Fountain, for example. The bottom line is, if you are looking for luxury, don't book this place, but if you want a clean and comfortable budget hotel in Rome, the Virginia is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: walter6504
Reviews.Content: Price of hotel is good considering others in Rome. Room is very small. Noise level high. No Internet is available. We used an Internet cafe a couple of blocks away. Located about 10 minutes walk from Termini station. Air conditioned. Friendly staff. For breakfast, you get a ticket and go to a cafe next door for a cup of coffee and a roll. Safe in room. No major problems but not sure if I would return unless I was on a strict budget.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and great value”
Reviews.Author: pony1127
Reviews.Content: I stayed Hotel Virginia for four nights on May. It takes about 10-15 mins from Rome Termini to the Hotel, and the hotel located in a quiet corner. The receptionists were nice and room was clean. I did have good night sleep there and enjoyed the simple breakfast provided downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, convenient and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBella67
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome with no hotel booking, and wanted to stay 3-4 nights. We arrived at this hotel and were told that for 40 Euros we could have an ensuite queen room for the night but as they were renovating, they weren't sure whether they could accommodate us longer than that. As it was late in the day, we accepted. Our room, on the 3rd floor (there is an elevator) was clean if a little run down. The bathroom was very good, though small, with shampoo & soap supplied as well as hairdryer and towels etc. The room itself was tiny, with the bed only just fitting in, but there was a little balcony, a table and 2 chairs inside, a TV with plenty of channels (only a couple in English), ample closet space and a safe. The room was one due to be renovated, and is probably beautiful now. At the time, the room was a little shabby and run-down but still very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included, coffee and pastry at a lovely café next door. The reception staff were very friendly and we loved them even more when they told us we could stay as many nights as we wanted in the same room! The hotel is a short walk to Roma Termini, 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and as far to the Metro. Overall a great stay, amazing rates for the quality, couldn't have asked for better. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and small double room”
Reviews.Author: olovelyworld
Reviews.Content: The actual double room was much smaller than on the photos. Even worse, it's very very noisy at nights. People comes and goes all the time and slam their doors. The bathroom was so small that you essentially have to lean your head against wall when sitting on the loo. The shower in our room didn't work properly neither. Overall very unhappy experience. The area where the hotel located is not very pleasant neither - hard to find good quality restaurants nearby. The only advantage is it's close to train station, about 15 min walk ( Which actually explains why it's not a very good area)

Reviews.Title: “Was Ok!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaMalta
Reviews.Content: The location is very good close to almost all attractions and if you like to walk while on holiday it's excellent. The lift only works from the first floor to the other floors so you have to go up the stairs for the first floor.. It was ok for us since our luggages weren't that heavy. A small breakfast is given at the bar below the hotel - a croissant and something to drink .. it was also quite good. The room was satisfactory only the other rooms were a bit noisy they used to meet out side their room at around 2am and chat in the corridor unfortunately. Howerver it as a good hotel for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: AmolAZ
Reviews.Content: The location was good. Walkable to the central station and metro. Everything was ok not bad and not so exceptional. I like it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but not bad at all..”
Reviews.Author: Vasilis26
Reviews.Content: (+) perfect location, right next to Temrini the rooms and the bathroom were clean both times I went (bathroom was new) 24hour reception both times I visited rooms were spacious reasonable price (for being in the centre of Rome) (-) no wifi or at least a common PC room a bit old, especially the hallway and the tapicerie on the walls of the rooms no lift till the first floor breakfast really is not worth paying for.. it is just a croissant ad a coffee in a nearby cafe.. if you want a budget accomodation in the very centre of Rome (where everyithing is expensive..) for a few days, this hotel is not bad at all..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tadzmahal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located because it´s near the Termini station, but the sleep quality is very bad. The room is very small and the double bed has those springs that makes your partner jump with every move you make so no sleep is possible. So I ended up sleeping on the floor... There was also problem with the bathroom. Water came out from the sink and it stink quite a lot. When we said the on the reception, they just put bigger towel on the floor. The service of the reception was also very random. One of the guys know a lot and always helped us the others didn´t know much about Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: clareoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Termini Train Station and within walking distance of the city, or there are plenty of buses close by. Great value, air conditioning, quiet, spacious rooms. The evening front desk guy is awesome - he knows everything, what buses to catch anywhere and where to eat etc, very helpful indeed! The only little downside was the slight smell in the bathroom. However, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money, great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelGuelph
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Virginia over the telephone. Giorgio did not want to take a credit card. Since we were flying into Roma and it would be our first night, we were a little nervous that there would be no booking for 5 tired travellers. There was no need because they were ready and waiting for us. For someone looking for a reasonable, well located place to stay in Rome without draining your pocketbook, this place deserves a second look. Staff is very friendly and helpful and rooms although sporting dated décor, are clean and comfortable. Location within walking distance of Termini station is a plus. Breakfast includes a coffee and cake or croissant in a local bar next door and is enough to get you on your way for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: We booked a quadruple room at Hotel Virginia at the last minute on Venere.com when our other accommodation did not meet our expectations. The hotel is in close proximity to Roma Termini (about ten minutes walk), but it was a pain when we were dragging our luggages. We should have taken a cab instead and could have avoided arriving at the hotel all puffing and drenched in sweat. It was hot when we left the train station. The good: 1. There was an elevator (although small) and it worked. But it did not go all the way to the ground floor so we still had to carry our luggages to the reception area at the first floor. 2. The room rate for a quadruple room quoted by Venere.com was of good value considering this is Rome. 3. Ensuite bathroom, working a/c, relatively clean room, free breakfast. 4. The Sri Lankan who manned the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The not so good: 1. The room was cramped for four beds; the shower stall would be a challenge for bulky people 2. No internet / wifi available 3. Breakfast (croissant and coffee/orange juice) was served outside of the hotel in a "bar" located in the next corner along Via Castelfidardo Still, the good outweighed the not so good. The hotel still served its purpose for my family especially when we just wanted to plop on our beds after an exhausting day touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: cescalina1988
Reviews.Content: After a mix up with the hotel we had booked left my friends and I in Rome with nowhere to stay we got online and found this gem. 5 minutes walk from Termini station, which includes the bus station and the metro station, we were able to in 2 days see a great deal of the city. There were many bars and restaurants near the hotel (about 5 pizzerias within a 1 minute radius!) and the hotel gave us coupons for breakfast in the bar on the next corner every morning. The rooms were clean, comfortable and with ensuite facilities. We paid 60 euros a night for each double room which translated to 30 a head. I feel that this was exceptional value for this hotel, and it perfectly suited our need, a base from which we could go sightseeing during our weekend in Rome. Remember also that we booked on the day we arrived so perhaps when booking in advance the prices would be different. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Close to main railway station”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to main railway station - 10 minute walk, giving easy access to central Rome and attractions. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in this area, however, there is a lot of noise from the street. Make sure you ask for a room at the back to avoid the noise. Staff were very helpful and although we arrived at 11am, our room was available. Breakfast is taken at a bar around the corner and is just a croissant and coffee. If you want a cheap, clean hotel for a couple of nights in Rome, then this hotel is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Christy84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. The cost for four nights for a double room was E200 between the two of us, which I have to say was cheap for Rome. Very close to the main train station in Rome which is the Termini station. Breakfast was going to a local cafe around the corner for a coffee and a crossaint and that's it. Not impressed by that as annoying to have to leave the hotel altogether for your breakfast. Room was very basis. A small T.V with no English stations. The bathroom was small but good water pressure from the shower. Literally if you just want a place to sleep then Virginia is perfect. The only problem I had was nights were I was staying in and not being able to watch T.V as all Italian stations. Please please do not get a taxi from the Termini train station to this hotel. The taxi people outside the train station were going to charge E30.00!!! It literally is only a 10 minute walk from the station. When you come out of main doors of the station turn left, follow the road until you get to the lights. Once you get to the lights cross over and it is a straight walk. The virginia hotel is the third right. Look out for via Montabella Road. There is a streak house right across the road. Very cheap but lacked atmosphere. The area where the Virginia hotel is not lively at all. For night time best to head to the area around the Termini. The supermarket near by was good. When you come out of the hotel turn left and your next turn go left again, can't miss it. The staff were very friendly. All in all good location from Termini station

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, expensive, a little run down but we loved it. Hey it's Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BigIcePete
Reviews.Content: There was barely enough room for our double bed, a small round table and two chairs in our room. The place was pretty weary in decoration and fittings. We lived in our tiny room for 3 days but we loved it. Five minutes walk to Termini station or Piazza della Republica (Metro & other facilities). Lots of bars, internet cafes, gelati and pizza shops, a small supermarket about a block away. There was a street market out on the street on a Wednesday. Staying in Rome ain't like staying in the countryside in England or in L.A. or in a high-rise in Melbourne. This place was "relatively" cheap for Rome, convenient, friendly and safe without too much noise in the rooms (thin walls). You're in Rome. You rough it a little walk the city streets at night, enjoy the chaos amidst the amazing history & charm of the ancient city. We were happy with our stay and wouldn't hesitate staying there again, though something a bit bigger would be better if we could afford it! Breakfast was very basic at a corner cafe nearby, a sweet croisant & a coffee/juice. It was enough, we "did like the Romans" and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel - OK value (by Rome standards)”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1234055
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome seem expensive compared to some other cities, but the Virginia Hotel looked OK value (for a triple room) compared to some other hotels in the centre. Good location for Termini station (5 to 10 minute walk) and access to good value Rome public transport system. Rooms very small (especially the shower cubicle), in need of some basic re-docorating, but clean. It's two star rating is deserved. Very friendly staff. Didn't try the breakfasts (provided in the bar next door) - looked very basic, so went to one of the many nearby cafes (spoilt for choice). Would I look elsewhere on next visit to Rome - probably yes, but mostly for a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, cheap for the area and good location”
Reviews.Author: fiddleplayer1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Virginia was clean, in a convenient location and reasonably priced for the area. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was small but we were only using it to sleep in. The area round the hotel felt perfectly safe even at midnight and was not seedy. The breakfast at the cafe was standard Italian but was served efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Greattraveller64
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was very well situated, well priced, friendly staff. For those that only go to the chain american hotels then this may not be the type of place that would suit you. If you are open to a simple, inexpensive, no frills, clean place ... then I recommend it. If you want only 5 star amenities then either stay home or pay big bucks. it is not in a seedy area, it was safe, clean and accessible. Being close to Termini train station is key. If you need to take the subway to get around it is easily accessible. The breakfast was typical European style including coffee and croissant. There was a street market every day on the same street of the hotel until 1 pm. Here you can shop buy fruit and browse. You have a coffee shop right downstairs, a great restaurant accross the street called Steak House. This is very convenient after a full day of sites and if you are tired. Great pizza by the slice at 3p down the street also. Only recommendation is if you think of sharing a room with 4 adults it is tight when you factor in at least 3 suitcases. I recommend 2 per room. We had 2 children with us ages 10 and 11 and they had bunk beds in our room and we had a king size bed. It was great. However, our other group of 4 adults were a little tight since rooms are so small. Price is so good its worth having 2 rooms for 4 adults. I would go back any time and I would recommend it and already have. Thanks for a great time to Hotel Virginia and Rome. We love Rome its the best city in the world!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable for a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Vannegen
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its relatively low price and good location (10 min. walk from the Termini station, close to several bus lines). Indeed, it is a small cosy hotel in an old typical Rome building. The rooms are spacious enough, the furniture adequate. The breakfast is symbolic: you get a "breakfast ticket" and have to walk some 100-200 meters to a nearby cafe, where on presenting this "ticket" you get a tea (or coffee) and one croissant. Fortunately, there is a supermarket nearby, very close to Piazza Indipendenza (as you walk out of the hotel, turn left to the next junction, and then left again and walk for 3-4 minutes - you'll see it to the rigth). One annoying thing about this hotel was the fact that on making the reservation we clearly asked for a quiet room. We were given one that was exactly at the corner of the two streets the hotel is located at, just above the restaurant on the ground floor, and - which was most annoying - our room was just close to the reception room. Until late at night, we heard conversations there and people (hotel staff) having a good time (loudly talking, laughing etc.), probably to kill the boredom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff! Good value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Anna43800
Reviews.Content: Hotel Virginia is about 10 minutes walk from Termini (the main train station). It was convinient because we just took a train from the airport, and saved money on the taxi. When we got to the hotel there was a problem with the elevator, it wasn't working from the ground floor, so we had to carry our luggage up the stairs 1 flight. It was working from the 1st floor up, though. Our room was on the 2nd floor, so we could use the elevator to go 1 flight up. I would say that was the only problem that we had at that hotel. Everything else was OK. I understood going there that it was not a 5 star hotel, so it did meet my expectations of what I was paying per night. The room was small (hey, it's only to sleep), shower was tiny (at least I had one in the room!), and breakfast was just coffee and croissant (it was free). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great, so I would recommend this hotel to anyone who traveling on the budget, and just needs a room to spend the night, between the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Sun81
Reviews.Content: After much research I found that Rome was a very expensive place to stay with hostals and low star hotels coming in at minimum 85e a room. Not only that but their location wasn't all that good or their standard. However Virginia is a real gem and the perfect place to stay if you are only on a long weekend break. The location could not be better as it's a 5 minute walk to the main train station where the airport bus drops you off, where you catch the metro to the Colosseum and Spanish steps and the bus down town to the Piazza Novona and trevi fountain and Pantheon. The hotel itself is extremely clean the bathrooms are small but spotless and the rooms cleaned everyday. Breakfast is a coffee and croissant in the cafe round the corner. All this for 40 a night is outstanding and I would not hesitate in recommending this to anyone. Having walked past a few 110 a night hotels I had considered booking I am glad I never...the price difference really does not justify it. This hotel was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Girls travelling solo - Beware of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fcwalt
Reviews.Content: If I were only to describe the hotel facilities, I would say that my staying at Hotel Virginia was great. Clean room, with tv and a private bathroom, really close to the Termini Train station, an exceptional deal for under 50 euros a night. The only problem I had while staying in this hotel was the night receptionist, a middle age guy who took advantage of the fact I was a girl travelling solo and decided to hit on me from the second I put my feet on the hotel. (I am aware of the Italian men "fame" for being flirty and all that, but I didnt expect that from a hotel staff member) I didn´t feel safe staying there, so I checked out two nights before. I wouldn´t recommend girls travelling solo to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not great by any standards”
Reviews.Author: hotpants3
Reviews.Content: Booked in due to flight times for one night only (thankfully) triple room. Arrived at hotel to find it was on first floor and the lift couldnt be accessed. So up the flight of stairs we went with our three suitcases when the bannister pole came away in one of our hand crashing to the bottom of stairs. Went into reception room wasnt ready we were asked to leave our bags on floor beside door were other bags had been left too, off we went returning couple hours later to discover one of our bags had gone missing! You can imagine how a person would feel on discovering this... everything was in this bag has we had just left another hotel packed the bag with car keys/handbag/purse etc... Items that were not needed till our final departure the next day, Two staff on now at this time the guy who we had checked in with earlier and a lady behind the desk ,The guy looked around at all the bags left by the door counting out three bags to us I think he was hoping that by some magic the missing bag was all of a sudden be there he looked into a small room were again the bag was not there, by this time we could see the worry on the mans face while the lady sat behind the desk totally disconcerned one of our group asked the lady while the man went out of the reception area was there a chance that the bag was left in the room we had booked she said no! another 10mins had passed at this stage our group were more than worried now (more sick at the stomach now) when the lady still sitting at desk spoke to the man in Italian he disappeared out of the reception room yet again, A secuity tv was on the wall covering the stairways the lady looked up at it and saw that the man was returning down the stairs with our suitcase. Sighs off great relieve all round... The lady mentioned something about how her friend the porter had lifted the wrong suitcase into a room that he was in love and did not know what he was doing. (not good). we were then asked to pay for our room up front before we seen it, were given key to room at this stage getting the suitcase back was our main concern and was just happy to get it back, went into room very basic double/single beds with not much room, bathroom shabby ,electrics dodgy shower broken tiles water pressure good and hot but wouldnt reccomend hotel, but may suit other people depending on what you want from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place despite the location!”
Reviews.Author: greekfreak21
Reviews.Content: The area looks sketchy, but it's really fine - we never had problems. The hotel is really close to Termini station, which will take you all over Rome, including the airport. There are also a bunch of good restaurants nearby (get bruschetta and panna cotta!). The front desk people are fairly helpful and the rooms are really nice for the price - and they have AC!! If you visiting in the summer AC is a lifesaver. The room was really clean, fairly spacious and complete with a refrigerator. The bathroom was nice, as well, and had a line to dry your clothes on. The only downside of this hotel is that the front desk is on the second floor (called the first floor in Europe, where as the first floor in the USA is called the ground floor in Europe) and the elevator does not come to the ground floor, so you have to drag your suitcases up one floor. Breakfast is good, but small. I would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Neil_Wi
Reviews.Content: What a find. A great family run hotel, near enough to the local transportation (2 subways within 10 minutes), but far enough away from the attractions to make local traders not "boost" their prices. Don't be put off by the location - its brilliant. If you want a 5* hotel look elsewhere. Rooms were clean and functional - a place to crash out after a busy day. Shower was excellent - plenty of hot water. Area is busy - noise may put some people off. Cafe / Bar is under the hotel - opens early for breakfast (coffee etc) - enough to get you moving in a morning - and stays open late for a few drinks. Well attended by locals as well. If I was going to Rome again I would most definately stay here, and recommend it to anyone looking for a value for money place to stay. Plenty of local bars and restaurants to cover all tastes. Need I say more.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable choise”
Reviews.Author: radu72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is verry close to the railstation (5min to walk) or to the Repubblica subway station (5min). On the same street you have 2 pizza ristorante, 1 internetpoint, 2or3 bar's. Verry clean but small. Open really 24 to 24. The personal verry friendly with the clients but not preparated to give specific turistic informations. On check-in they give you a citymap and a postcard for free. The breakfast is not in the hotel but in a bar, right on the corner of the street (1capuccino+1croisant), 5meters away from the hotel. It was a good choise, we will return there!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Virginia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenOz
Reviews.Content: We paid 100Euro for two nights - double room 401. I read a couple of bad reviews on this website but i must say i would recommend this place for the price we paid. Room was very clean - Shower was strong and tv worked fine. There is a heater/air con. but worked out that you need to get the remote from reception - they will not provide it at checkin. We did not think b/fast was included but we got a coffee and pastry from the the cafe on the corner in the price. Great location - easy walk from train station and to the Forum. Staff were very friendly and a safe area to stay when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in November 2006. Good Points: -Price was great -Clean Room -Not too far from Train Station -Friendly guy at reception -Breakfast was simple, but yum Bad Points: -Shower was WAY too small, i could barely move around -Hotel area was quite seedy. Not the greatest area -No Phone in room Overall the hotel wasn't too bad. It was very basic though. I probably would not stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Virginia?”
Reviews.Author: Black64
Reviews.Content: Not sure what hotel we ended up staying at, as we got taken from Hotel Virginia to another hotel around the corner by the concierge. Breakfast was very disappointing, with a crossiant on a serviette and a hot drink reluctantly provided by the cafe on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lost our reservation”
Reviews.Author: nicski
Reviews.Content: We booked with a website that didn't allow changes to the reservation, so when our airline delayed our flight one day, we had to cancel the existing reservation and rebook for one day later. The hotel staff only saw the cancellation and ignored the rebook. When we arrived, we were told that they had our new reservation, but that they were full and could no longer accommodate us. The woman at the desk was at first very rude, but did help us find a room around the corner. She was apologetic in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Wongai
Reviews.Content: Typical of the cheaper hotels in Rome - old but clean enough and that's about it. Breakfast was a token which you presented to a restaurant nearby and you got a bun and a coffee. Alas, one only gets what one pays for ...... I will look elsewhere next time and pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Very seedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived late to Termini Station, so we wanted a place w/in walking distance. Our walk was a bit scary as the neighborhood seemed very seedy, but we did not actually have any issues on our way there. On first glance the room was cute with character. However, one of the window latches was broken so, it would't open, and there was no AC. It was quite loud below our window as there were people at restaurants still (at 1:30 am!). Room smelled very musty and old. Bathroom was newer, but very inconvenient. The way the shower was set up, a great deal of water would end up on the floor. They don't provide bath mats or rugs, so the water just sat there. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: TuscanDreamer
Reviews.Content: After a very difficult search for a hotel in Rome, we booked at the Virginia. We've been to Rome a few dozen times so we did not expect much and were very happy with what we found there. The room was clean, quiet, nicely decorated and had some extras that we actually did not need....like cable TV and a hairdrier...but we found these nice. The location is good, not in the hustle and bustle of the tourists (but, everything was in walking distance) and there was even a charming street market near by. Breakfast is the typical Italian one...pastry and capuccino...yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: risakov
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Virginia with 2 friends during 1st week of June. Payed 115 euros/night for triple room. Located ~ 10 mins from Stazione Termine. (as we were walking with our suitecases to the hotel from termini station, witnessed pick-pocketing, well, fortunatelly, the guy got his wallet back. Bed springs were making a lot of noise. AC worked well. Beds were not made on the weekend. Bathroom was small, but looked new. Shower head was almost broken. Door knob was very weird (to get out of the room had to use the key, how weird is that?). Overall, located in good location. Breakfast was 7:30 to 11 am (get a ticket @ the hotel desk) on the immediate right of the hotel (small cafe place). You get a cappuccino and a crussaint (not enough though). Place is O.K but not great. Laundrymat is next block, so is the internet in the same laundrymat. There is no phone in the room. Public phone on the 4th floor (use coins). The hotel manager, the guy from Peru, at the desk, is the only helpful one, don't even bother with other people @ the desk. When you exit the hotel, on the left, there is Pizzeria, after 6 pm - Happy Hour - 1 slice for 1 euro, beer - 2 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Virginia was about ten minutes walk-with suitcases- from Termini station.The staff was helpful but the lift only worked from the first floor up so we had to lug the suitcases up the steps... the room was small but clean, as was the bathroom. There was a small TV but no phone or fridge. Breakfast was coffee and a roll at the bar next door. The Andrea restaurant had an excellent lunch menu at 10-11 Euros. In the neighbourhood are laundry and internet facilities. Buses about five minutes walk from the hotel. We paid 60 Euros a night(in March 2005) which was reasonable. Suggested for budget-minded tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Only a five minute walk from Termini station and very easy to find if you already have a map. I would suggest you take a taxi the first time to get there, which should cost you about 3.50 - 4.00 Euro (Take the official taxi with the Roma sticker on the side). The rooms were very nice for what you are paying and very clean. This is a great hotel for the average traveller not for the traveller who needs a very spacioius place. The only bad thing I could say about the hotel is the bathroom is pretty cramped, but it's manageable. Your included breakfast will be a voucher at the adjacent cafe, which includes a moring drink and pastery. There is an excellent pizzeria/Steakhouse accross the street, which I would highly suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Drzava
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel on the upper floors of a building in a 'local' area of Rome. The place certainly isn't the Ritz, but for the price we paid we felt that it was excellent value for money. If you want luxury, pay three times as much elsewhere. Location is pretty good, about 5 min walk northwest of Termini station. Staff were friendly. As has been mentioned, the 'included breakfast' consists of vouchers for a cafe downstairs which has delicious pastries and coffee (and beer!). Coffee from the machine in the hotel 'lobby was also surprisingly good! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, providing a map and allowing us to store luggage after checking out on the last day. The bathroom facilities were excellent and we even had a small kitchen in the room! Everything was spotlessly clean. Although ‘breakfast included’ meant a voucher for the café downstairs, I saw this as a bonus: as well as some delicious coffee and pastries, we enjoyed seeing a slice of Italian culture, as the café was mostly frequented by locals rather than tourists. The location was ideal – only 5-10 mins walk to Termini, but not close enough to be noisy. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by some of the negative reviews unless you have very high expectations and lots of dosh to spend. For the room rates in Rome, I doubt you'll get much better. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are compact, but clean, pleasant and comfortable. The area is undramatic, but interesting with it's mix of locals, immigrants and travellers. The cafe/bar where you take your breakfast is great. The big guy with the shaved head is a real character. The Andrea Restaurant closeby is a real find. Great food, excellent prices. If you feel adventurous, there's at least a couple of Ethiopian restaurants nearby, which regretably we didn't visit. There's also a small street market on Fridays and Saturdays at least. There is a strip bar and a XXX Cinema on the street, but it's not in your face. Hardly makes it a red light area! Most of the main sights are easy walking distance unless you're debilitated. Lastly, the Virginia is only 5 minutes walk from Termini, so all in all we were perfectly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but we wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Virginia in June 2004. We chose it because of its price. The room was clean and quite nicely furnished. However, the hotel isn't conveniently located, and we found we had travel by bus and metro to see many of the sights. It was hot at night and although the room had air conditioning, the staff in reception had the only remote control and they weren't very forthcoming with it. We had to demand that they bring it to our room and turn the air conditioning off and on for us. Overall we weren't impressed with the service; we found most of the staff to be neither friendly nor helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Hotel Virginia and would stay there again. The staff was very friendly and the location was great -- a 5 minutes walk from the Repubblica metro stop and National Museum. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. It had a fridge and A/C at night. The best part was that the "included breakfast" was actually vouchers for coffee and pastries at the cafe downstairs -- some of the best we had in Italy! There was some street noise from restaurants and the market (at night and starting at 7am), so ask for a room on the upper levels. It's probably the best hotel you could find for the price -- we'd definitely recommend it to people we like.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto on Hotel Virginia”
Reviews.Author: halledawg
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels that I booked on line, Hotel Virginia was the worse. About the only good thing I can say was that is was near the train station. We did not even stay there after we saw the room. I just absorbed the one night cost and found a room easily right near the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dudet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our stay at the Hotel Virginia in Rome. We were thrilled with it. The location is great, walking distance to just about all the main monuments. The room was kept very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our stay at the Hotel Virginia. We were there for 3 nights. The location was good, 10 minute walk to the train station. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. But....we were put in a room that was recently redone, and not fully completed. No telephone, no hairdryer (they did provide one after requesting) and the television did not work properly. The room was small, but clean. Another draw back was that when a toilet was flushed in a room near by, you were scalded if you were taking a shower. The hallways were still in the process of remodeling, so it was quite unattractive. Breakfast was provided with our room, but it consisted of a pastry and coffee/tea in a shop that was next to the hotel and only accessible from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Virginia”
Reviews.Author: LouiseCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value ofr money, very near the Termini but a bit of a walk from the main sights, it is very clean and in good decorative order. The only slight worry was security as the reception was not always covered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sevice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is wonderful. It's location and price are ideal. The staff is friendly and multi-lingual. I stayed here in March of 2000 and I just recently made reservations for March 2004.
